content:
Drug: Morphine | cid: 5288826
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Morphine including uses, images, dosage, effects, legal status, and links to other resources.
Erowid name: morphine
Category: PHARMS
Field: MainPage

                    Text: 
                    Donate and receive yours!

Morphine



COMMON & BRAND NAMES

MS Contin; Oramorph; Roxanol; Avinza; Kapanol

EFFECTS CLASSIFICATION

Opioid Narcotic Analgesic

CHEMICAL NAME

(5a,6a)-7,8-didehydro-4,5-epoxy-17-methylmorphinan-3,6-diol

DESCRIPTION

Morphine is an opiate used in the treatment of severe pain. It occurs naturally in the opium poppy and has a long history of human use.

BASICS

EFFECTS

IMAGES

HEALTH

LAW

DOSE

CHEMISTRY

GENERAL INFORMATION #

Morphine Timeline

RELATED VAULTS #

Codeine Vault

Hydrocodone Vault

Oxycodone Vault

Fentanyl Vault

Buprenorphine Vault

ASK EROWID ANSWERS #

Are my antique drugs still good?

RESEARCH & JOURNAL ARTICLES #

How human neuroblastoma cells make morphine

EXPERIENCES #

Control is an Illusion, by Ikeavelli

Hotel Bathroom Extravaganza, by Atonable Junky

To Hell and Back, by Morphina

Basic Morphine Prep and the Experience, by Drug Geek

On the Magickal Uses of Opioids, by Glozey


                    Context: 
                    This section provides detailed information on morphine, including its common names, pharmacological classification, chemical structure, and description as a natural opioid used for pain relief. It also links to related vaults, research articles, experiences, and health resources, making it a key reference within the broader Erowid drug and plant database.
